title: Rivertop Renewables and DTI open glucaric acid plant in Danville, US
text:
Rivertop Renewables and DTI open glucaric acid plant in Danville, US 8 October 2015 Print Email 
US specialty chemicals company Rivertop Renewables and DTI have jointly opened a glucarate acid production plant at DTI's Danville, Virginia, US site. 
DTI spent around $7m to expand its Danville facility, which was announced in 2012, with construction completed last year. 
Rivertop's glucarate-based products are said to be sustainable, high-performing and cost-competitive. "We are pleased to see all the hard work we have done with Rivertop has resulted in a successful startup of the facility." 
Rivertop CEO Mike Knauf said: "This is the first of several planned production facilities for our patented technology. 
"We're producing three different products for customers in a variety of industries, and the success here in Danville is paving the way for investment in additional glucarate capacity." 
The new facility will mainly produce three product lines, including Riose, an automatic dishwasher detergent; Waterline, a water treatment industry additive with corrosion inhibitors and chelating agents; and Headwaters, a corrosion inhibitor for salt brine mixtures used as a de-icer on roads. 
The facility will use Rivertop's proprietary oxidation process technology, and expects to produce Â£10m per year. 
DTI president Paul Bacon said: "We are pleased to see all the hard work we have done with Rivertop has resulted in a successful startup of the facility. 
"We're proud to produce their range of products that offers innovation to traditional industries, giving customers new options to improve their products in a sustainable and cost-competitive manner." 
DTI is a custom manufacturer of fine and specialty chemical products. 
Both companies are planning to open new facilities, and Rivertop expects to produce one or two new products every year, expanding its presence into other industries and countries. 
The new facility is expected to create around 20 jobs. Follow Us:
